The new upscale restaurant downtown sounds like a great option! Reserving a private room will definitely add to the exclusivity and luxury of the celebration.

**Formal Invitations vs. Digital Invites:**

For a vintage glamour-themed birthday party, I would recommend sending out formal, printed invitations to match the sophisticated atmosphere. Here's why:

* Formal invitations will set the tone for the elegant celebration and give your guests an idea of what to expect.
* They'll add a touch of luxury and sophistication to the overall experience.
* Guests are more likely to RSVP promptly and take the event seriously when they receive a physical invitation.

That being said, if you're short on time or prefer a more modern approach, digital invitations can still be effective. You could design a beautiful, gold-and-silver-themed evite that captures the essence of the vintage glamour theme.

**Tips for Formal Invitations:**

* Choose a high-quality paper or cardstock with a subtle sheen to match the luxurious theme.
* Design the invitation to resemble a vintage-style poster or a classic Hollywood premiere invitation.
* Include all the essential details, such as date, time, location, dress code, and RSVP information.
* Consider adding a touch of elegance with a ribbon, a wax seal, or a custom envelope liner.

**Tips for Digital Invitations:**

* Design a visually stunning evite with gold and silver accents, elegant fonts, and a sophisticated layout.
* Use a digital invitation platform that allows you to track RSVPs and send reminders.
* Make sure to include all the necessary details and a clear call-to-action for guests to RSVP.

Ultimately, the choice between formal invitations and digital invites depends on your personal preference, budget, and the overall tone you want to set for the celebration. If you do decide to go with digital invitations, make sure they're just as elegant and sophisticated as the party itself.
